attributes.action: Abandon all plans to close or downgrade the services currently offered at Worthing and Southlands hospitals
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The debts in the area served by the former Surrey and Sussex Strategic Health Authority area are around £100m

In the past year,Worthing Hospitals have closed over 50 beds in an attempt to save money

Local fears are growing that the SHA’s plans could see the downgrading of services at Worthing Hospitals
One or both hospitals could lose its Accident and Emergency and other major facilities, with major trauma cases being transferred to Portsmouth or Brighton. The worst case scenario is that one of the hospitals could close altogether. 

The SHA seems intent on downgrading critical care provision without ensuring that the necessary improvements to community care are in place
